title: Supercells of a single raster layer
text: first step read input data. , going use volcano.tif example data already included supercells package.  contains digital elevation model Maunga Whau volcano, value represents elevation sea level. supercells package can used delineate areas similar elevations. one main function, supercells(), expects least three arguments: x - input raster (object class SpatRaster terra package) k - expected number supercells compactness - compactness value. Larger values create compact/even (square) supercells supercells() output sf object, row represents single superpixel. stores supercell ids (supercells), coordinates supercell centers (x y), average input variables (elevation case). allows us plot supercells’ borders top input raster data:  vol_slic1 object can final result analysis used grouping clustering.
code: vol = rast(system.file("raster/volcano.tif", package = "supercells")) plot(vol) vol_slic1 = supercells(vol, k = 50, compactness = 1) vol_slic1 plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic1), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

title: Supercells of a single raster layer
text: supercells() function also set optional arguments, including: step - distance (number cells) initial superpixel’ centers. can used instead k dist_fun - distance function used calculate similarities raster values clean - connectivity supercell enforced? FALSE, supercells consist several nonadjacent regions. TRUE default. iter - number iterations performed create output. 10 default. Let’s try change values : output still structure (sf object supercell ids, coordinates centers, average input variables), slightly different number supercells, borders bit different.
code: vol_slic2 = supercells(vol, step = 11, compactness = 1, dist_fun = "euclidean",                         clean = FALSE, iter = 10) plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic2), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

text: data.frame single row global metrics columns: Interpretation: mean_value_dist Lower values indicate homogeneous supercells. mean_spatial_dist Lower values indicate compact supercells. mean_combined_dist Overall distance; mainly useful ranking. balance 0 indicates balance value spatial terms; negative values indicate spatial dominance; positive values indicate value dominance. step Step size used generate supercells. compactness Compactness value used generate supercells. n_supercells Number supercells least one non-missing pixel. mean_value_dist Mean per-supercell value distance cells supercell centers, averaged across supercells. title: Creates supercells — supercells
text: x object class SpatRaster (terra) class stars (stars) k number supercells desired user (output number can slightly different!). can use either k step. also possible provide set points (sf object) k together step value create custom cluster centers. compactness compactness value. Larger values cause supercells compact/even (square). Set compactness = "auto" enable SLIC0-style adaptive compactness. compactness value depends range input cell values selected distance measure. dist_fun distance function. Currently implemented distance functions "euclidean", "jsd", "dtw" (dynamic time warping), name distance function philentropy package (see philentropy::getDistMethods(); "log2" used case), user defined function accepting two vectors returning one value. Default: "euclidean" avg_fun averaging function - values supercells' centers calculated? algorithm internally implements common functions "mean" "median" (provided quotation marks), also accepts fitting R function (e.g., base::mean() stats::median(), provided plain function name: mean). Default: "mean". See details information. clean connectivity supercells enforced? iter number iterations performed create output. transform Transformation performed input. default, transformation performed. Currently available transformation "to_LAB": first, conversion RGB LAB color space applied, supercells algorithm run, afterward, reverse transformation performed obtained results. (argument experimental may removed future). step distance (number cells) initial supercells' centers. can use either k step. minarea Specifies minimal size supercell (cells). works clean = TRUE. default, clean = TRUE, average area () calculated based total number cells divided number supercells Next, minimal size supercell equals /(2^2) (right shifted) metadata Logical. TRUE, output object metadata columns ("supercells", "x", "y"). FALSE, output object metadata columns. chunks input (x) split chunks deriving supercells? Either FALSE (default), TRUE (large input objects split), numeric value (representing side length chunk number cells). TRUE, memory limit can set options(supercells.chunk_mem_gb = 4). verbose integer specifying level text messages printed calculations. 0 means messages (default), 1 provides basic messages (e.g., calculation stage).

title: supercells 1.8
text: compactness = "auto" enables SLIC0-style adaptive compactness Metrics now support SLIC0 adaptive compactness (pixels/supercells/global) sc_tune_compactness() returns step + one compactness, selected metrics = "global" "local" Chunked raster IDs now use consistent center-count offset strategy

title: supercells 1.7
text: Added sc_tune_compactness() estimate compactness short SLIC run Metrics API cleanup: renamed sc_metrics_clusters() sc_metrics_supercells(), unified metric names, _scaled suffix scaled outputs Balance metrics now use absolute log ratio scaled value/spatial distances iter = 0 works point outputs; polygons/rasters error guidance sc_slic()/sc_slic_points()/sc_slic_raster() dropped transform argument; legacy supercells() keeps transform = "to_LAB" New step_unit supports map-unit step sizes Chunking improvements: conservative memory estimates, options(supercells.chunk_mem_gb), chunk sizes align step, deterministic ID offsets file-backed merge Verbose argument moved end R C++ APIs Empty-cluster handling now consistent across cleanup Removed future-based parallel chunking

title: supercells 1.6
text: Spatial distance uses precise (fractional) center positions; neighborhood search still uses rounded centers (minor output differences expected vs 1.5) robust center handling (custom centers, empty centers) safer cleanup small regions Local-minimum search improved Tests standardized via tests/testthat/setup.R updated expectations

title: supercells 1.5
